page.title: 16TOR DOWN QUARRY,ST.BREWARD
page.content: TOR DOWN QUARRY IS SITUATED CLOSE TO ST BREWARD SHOP. IT IS A GRANITE QUARRY. IN THE OLD DAYS THERE USED TO BE ABOUT EIGHTY MEN WORKING THERE. ALL THESE PEOPLE WERE NEEDED TO HACK OUT THE STONE, CUT IT AND POLISH IT. THIS PROVIDED MOST OF THE EMPLOYMENT FOR THE VILLAGE. A NEAR BY STREAM WAS DIVERTED TO PROVIDE WATER FOR USE IN THE QUARRY. WATER WAS USED FOR WASHING THE STONE BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY IT POWERED A TURBINE ENGINE WHICH WAS USED TO CUT AND POLISH THE GRANITE. ALL THE LABOUR WAS DONE BY HAND BUT NOW THEY USE DIAMOND SAWS,DIGGERS, CRANES AND COMPRESSERS. NOW ONLY 4 PEOPLE ARE ENPLOYED AT TOR DOWN QUARRY. THE SCULPTOR DAVID WYNN WORKED ON HIS GIGANTIC MARBLE STATUE OF A BROWN BEAR AT THE QUARRY. THE STATUE WENT TO NEW YORK FOR THE PEPSI COLA COMPANY.
